p: We ran a set of log-linear models and found that the model accounting for differential homophily (i.e., where homophily varies by region, according to the mixing matrix; Table 2) is the best fit ( Table 4). The Marienfluss (e 5.951 = 384.1), Ozosemo (e 3.693 = 40.2), and Omunjandu (e 3.031 = 20.7) have the highest proportions of geographic homophily in sexual-partner selection compared with ranges of the coefficient exponents from Omaanda, Ehama, other regions, and Kaokoveld cities, which range from 3.9â€“14.9. Among our five sampled regions, the Marienfluss, Ozosemo, and Omunjandu also have the highest HSV-2 prevalences.
